data.details:
Are you looking to add to your outdoor adventures? Kayaking is a fun and exciting way to enhance your skills and add to your experiences! If you like to test your aquatic abilities and you love the outdoors, then this dual certification course is designed for you. This course is offered to all members ages 16 and up.

Prerequisites: Participants must be able to tread water for 5 minutes and swim with and without a life jacket for 25 yards.

Kayak Level 1- The morning session will teach beginner paddlers how to safely and enjoyably kayak on flat-water. You will learn basic paddling strokes such as forward stroke, turning strokes, and bracing strokes to safely guide your water craft.

Kayak Level 2- The afternoon session will prepare you for leading a kayak trip on a creek. You will learn how to prevent, recognize, and respond to aquatic emergencies. You will actively participate in water rescues, so be prepared to immerse yourself in water.

Special Instructions:
Bring a bathing suit and a change of clothes.
We suggest that you wear dry-wick (non-cotton) clothes.
Please bring a sack lunch, snacks, and water bottle.

Rate: $20.00

Last day to register online is Sun. April 19, 2015.
data.locationLabel: North Fork Girl Scout Camp - Weaver Pond
